# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
using DataFrames
using Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[!, :ym] = map(x -> parse(Int, string(year(x), lpad(month(x), 2, '0'))), df.dt)
    return df
end
```

Example usage:
```julia
df = DataFrame(dt = [Date(2022, 1, 1), Date(2022, 12, 31), Date(2023, 1, 1)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```

This will add a new column `ym` to the DataFrame `df` with the year and month extracted from the `dt` column and concatenated together as an integer in the format "yyyymm".
